item.title: Common Traps in Python - part 1
item.description: The traps of List in Python Assignment trap Note: Assignment with an = on lists does not make a copy. Instead, assignment makes the two variables point to the one list in memory. colors = ['red', 'blue', 'green'] b = colors ## Does not copy the list b [1] = "yellow" print (colors) # ['red', 'yellow', 'green'] print(b) # ['red', 'yellow', 'green'] and you may get really risky return
